column4: Hello, good morning: anybody knows how the superuser in linux can get the list of passwords of the other users???
so if the superuser needs to log in as one of the users to install a program, what can he do??
but it asks you one password, isnt it?
wth are you trying to do? You don't need to crack any passwords. If you are root, you have access to the entire system.
I want to configure a program to access internet of one of the users, but I only know to configure it in GDM (grafical mode)
but I dont know how to configure it using the console
just copy the file from another user's account.
but if I want to enter to an user's Desktop to put a direct access??
and there isnt any way to decript the passwords in /etc/passwd??
